sense.name: physically construct something, either directly or by implication
sense.commentary: Includes: BUILD ON, BUILD UP, BUILD UPON
sense.examples: I built this table myself. They built houses out of sod on the prairies. The government had to raise taxes in order to build new bridges and roads. These architects build in interesting and new styles. We are building up this swampland to accomodate the boom. This castle was built upon the blood and sweat of the poor.

sense.name: develop, increase
sense.examples: Resentment about her promotion is building in the office. The clouds over the sea were building into a dark storm front. Suspense was building right from the beginning of the opera.

sense.name: establish or create a complex process or abstract entity, according to a plan
sense.examples: Our company's reputation is built on a history of satisfied customers. He is building a nice medical practice in Raleigh. They built a modern nation from democratic principles and free trade. Will the defense build their case around a plea of insanity?

sense.name: BUILD IN: make something an integral part of a whole
sense.examples: We built in a special clause to make the contract better for you.

sense.name: BUILD UP: increase steadily and/or incrementally
sense.examples: Try to build up your savings when you graduate from college. Resistance to the manager's plan built up steadily. Troops are building up on the German border. Jack built up the confidence to ask Jill out.
